title: Manager of Enrollment, Family Engagement, and External Affairs
description:
**About Our School**


Opened in 2022, Vertex Partnership Academies is a virtues-based, International Baccalaureate (IB) public charter high school located in the Soundview section of the Bronx. We seek to develop virtuous high school graduates who have acquired the habits, knowledge, and sense of personal agency necessary to lead self-determined, purposeful lives of American and global citizenship. Our vision is to develop internationally-minded, tenacious learners guided by the four cardinal virtues of Courage, Justice, Temperance, and Wisdom.


Vertex Partnership Academies requires the International Baccalaureate Middle Years Programme for freshmen and sophomores and is proud to be an International Baccalaureate World School authorized to offer each of the Diploma and Career-related Programmes in the junior and senior years.


With this prestigious authorization, Vertex Partnership Academies is one of a handful of high schools worldwide that is an IB For All School offering three IB programs, meaning that 100% of Vertex students are required to pursue the IB Middle Years program in ninth and tenth grade, and then choose between the IB Diploma or IB Career-related Programmes pathway for their 11th and 12th-grade years.

**About The Role**  

  

As a key member of our School’s Network team, the Manager of Enrollment, Family Engagement, and External Affairs should be an experienced project manager who leads the charge on anticipating the need for designing and reflecting on systems in support of smooth school enrollment, family engagement, and external affairs processes. The individual in this role should be a self motivated, creative and critical thinker with a growth mindset , strong sense of personal agency and open to receiving feedback.  

  

**Responsibilities**

**Student Enrollment**

* Manages student recruiting process including outreach and tours for parents
* Oversees the upkeep of physical and digital student files and coordination of student enrollment
* Maintains student waiting list in accordance withState law; receives and organizes applications
* Ensures new student lottery is run in compliance with the law, works with school leadership to document process followed by an impartial party
* Transmits student transfer and withdrawal paperwork to and from students’ former or current school
* Ensures student information is accurate, organized, and filed as required by State law
* Works with student recruitment team and partner networks to market Vertex Partnership Academies to rising 7th and 8th graders.
* Develops enrollment processes and works with partner networks to ensure seamless management of online enrollment systems

 **Family Engagement**

* Creates and manages Parent Teacher Organization.
* Manages campus family meetings
* Plans and executes seasonal family engagement events that support school culture
* Ad-hoc reporting, as needed

**External Affairs & Special Projects**

* Manage donor operations, supporting the CEO in cultivating and maintaining relationships with donors to secure financial support for the organization.
* Work closely with the CEO and Chief Operations Advisor to identify strategies for growth including research of appropriate markets for growth, identifying appropriate facilities strategies, and creating plans for expansion as appropriate.
* Oversee external affairs, representing the organization in a professional manner and building partnerships with external stakeholders, including government agencies, community organizations, and other key influencers.
* Work with various stakeholders to ensure the network is accessing public funding streams and grant funding to support its various programs.

**School Operations**

* Support the School Ops team in certain initiatives, as required.
* Plan and coordinate logistics for family engagement events, including, but not limited to, pilot and Saturday programming, info. sessions, and student recruitment events.

 **Qualifications**  

  

*Required:*

* 3-5 years of administrative office experience, preferably in a school setting
* Strong organizational skills and thorough attention to detail
* Highly organized and works efficiently in a fast-paced work environment
* Flexibility of approach and a collaborative style
* Excellent interpersonal, organizational, communication, and collaborative skills
* Ability to maintain a calm, professional demeanor in the face of competing demands and external pressures
* Strong growth mindset, with a willingness to take personal responsibility, able to internalize and apply feedback with immediacy, dedication to effectiveness and excellence
* Experience with data management systems, such as: ATS, PowerSchool, Schoolmint, etc
* Exceptional computer skills, with fluency in Google Suite and Excel

*Nice to Have:*

* Fluency in Spanish
* Experience with IB School

**This role is a full-time, in-person opportunity.**  

  

**Physical Requirements**


This role may require lifting and carrying items weighing up to 20 pounds unassisted, including assisting coworkers when needed. Requires frequent bending, reaching, repetitive hand movements, standing, walking, squatting, sitting, and looking at a computer screen for long periods at a time.

**Compensation**  

The salary range for this position is $80,000-$115,000, offer will be commensurate with the candidate’s years of experience and credentials.  

  

As an employee, you are eligible for a benefits package, inclusive of paid time off, paid holidays, and a retirement plan.

**If you are located within the New Jersey territory and willing to travel up to 50% of your time to assigned territory, you will have the flexibility to work remotely\\* as you take on some tough challenges.**

* Coordinate care for members
* Make referrals to outside sources
* Coordinate services as needed (home health, DME, etc.)
* Educate members on disease processes
* Encourage members to make healthy lifestyle changes
* Document and track findings
* Make “welcome home” calls to ensure that discharged member receive the necessary services and resources

* Ability to navigate a Windows environment, utilize Outlook, and the ability to create, edit, save and send documents utilizing Microsoft Word and Excel
* Demonstrated ability to talk and type proficiently at the same time

title: Yard/Warehouse Rep I
description:
Founded in 1960, East Haven Builders Supply supplies building materials to customers from locations in New York and Connecticut, including a wall panel and truss manufacturing facility.  

  

US LBM provides a wide range of building materials to construction professionals, combining the advantages of our national scale with the excellent service levels, expertise, entrepreneurial culture and customer relationships of our local brands.  

  

As a people-first company, passionate about continuous improvement, US LBM is proud to provide our associates access to the resources, training and developmental opportunities to empower them to succeed today, while growing professionally and preparing for the challenges of tomorrow.  

  

**Pay Range:** $18.00 - $22.00/hour  

  

**Position Overview**  

  

Receive, stock, ship, order and count inventory items. This is an entry level position that is responsible for the safe operation of a forklift in order to stock all lumber and building materials. Perform duties within the established work and safety procedures.  

  

**Essential Job Duties**  

* Operate safely.
* Participate in a positive work environment
* Assist warehouse associates and direct supervisor in maintaining an organized work environment. May include, emptying trash receptacles, and keeping all bays and staging areas clean and organized.
* Receive incoming products, commodities and materials.
* Provides Excellent Customer Service
* Count and record receipt of materials.
* Stock all material received in appropriate bins or storage locations.
* Assist inventory control in counting and organizing warehouse materials.
* Comply with all company policies and guidelines.
* Operate forklift with foot and hand controls.
* May use forklift to build outgoing orders or to load completed orders onto delivery equipment
* Operate facility equipment as necessary (e.g. bander, power tools, various hand tools).
* Monitor inventory as required by location management.
* Retain an awareness of the work environment critical to the task at hand to produce error free and damage free results.
* Participates in and completes assigned trainings.
* Other duties as assigned by Management

  

**Knowledge, Skills & Abilities**  

* Minimum education preferred -High school diploma or GED.
* No experience required. Will train.
* Ability to do basic math, read orders, write instructions and complete forms.
* Ability/willingness to learn to read a tape measure.
* Ability to effectively and professionally communicate with customers, other employees and supervisors using verbal and written skills.

  

* Ability to deal constructively with conflict and recognize potential problems.
* Proficiency with or ability to learn current technologies (e.g. Smartphone, Inventory Control Systems, and other necessary business applications).
* Physical demands include standing and walking for extended periods of time, exposure to extreme temperatures, bending or stooping, regularly lifting up to 50 pounds and frequently up to 100 pounds or more.
